title: Lesson 08: Nonsquare Matrices
lesson_title: Nonsquare matrices as transformations between dimensions
objectives: Understand nonsquare matrices as transformations between dimensions

cards.front: What does an m×n matrix represent?
cards.back:
A transformation from n-dimensional space to m-dimensional space.

- n columns: n-dimensional input
- m rows: m-dimensional output

Transforms 2D vectors into 3D vectors.

The 2 columns indicate 2D input (2 basis vectors).
The 3 rows indicate each basis vector lands in 3D (3 coordinates).

Transforms 3D vectors into 2D vectors.

Compresses information from a higher dimension to a lower dimension.

Transforms 2D vectors into numbers (1D).

Maps vectors to points on a number line. This closely relates to the dot product.

cards.front: What is full rank for a nonsquare matrix?
cards.back:
When the rank equals the smaller of the two dimensions.

For a 3×2 matrix: full rank means rank 2 (the column space is a 2D plane in 3D space, not collapsed to a line).
